SummaryEnglish: "Memories" is made up of three separate science-fiction stories. In the first, "Magnetic Rose," four space travelers are drawn into an abandoned spaceship that contains a world created by one woman's memories. In "Stink Bomb," a young lab assistant accidentally transforms himself into a human biological weapon set on a direct course for Tôkyô. The final episode, "Cannon Fodder," depicts a day in the life of a city whose entire purpose is the firing of cannons at an unseen enemy.

1.SummaryEnglish: Memories is a 1995 Japanese animated science fiction anthology film with Katsuhiro Ootomo as executive producer, and based on three of his manga short stories. The film is composed of three shorts: Magnetic Rose (彼女の想いで Kanojo no Omoide), directed by Studio 4°C co-founder Kouji Morimoto and written by Satoshi Kon; Stink Bomb (最臭兵器 Saishuu-heiki), directed by Tensai Okamura of Darker than Black fame and written by Ootomo, and Cannon Fodder (大砲の街 Taihou no Machi), written and directed by Ootomo himself.

2.SummaryEnglish: "Katsuhiro Otomo's MEMORIES", a 1995 Japanese anthology film, features three separate animated shorts, collectively created by the greatest modern powerhouse animators of their time: "Magnetic Rose", directed by Kōji Morimoto [Animatrix, Genius Party, Macross Plus]. Written by Satoshi Kon [Perfect Blue, Tokyo Godfathers, Paprika] and animated at Studio 4 °C. "Stink Bomb", directed by Tensai Okamura [LOTGH, Metabots, Kuromukuro]. Also written by Satoshi Kon and animated at Studio Madhouse. "Cannon Fodder", written and directed by Otomo Katsuhiro [who gets top-billing as showrunner, also known for Akira, Metropolis, Dōmu, & Steamboy], animation by Studio 4 °C. The movie itself is intriguing enough to watch, though the production behind it, with all the limitations and hardships that fall upon the creators, is also a story within itself worth listening to.
